header.headertext: AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED IN COMMITTEE

text.quote: 000: Clause 1, page 1, line 6, leave out from “title” to end of line 7 and insert “will be succeeded by a living heir regardless of gender on the death of the present incumbent”
000: Clause 2, the Earl of Clancarty gives notice of his intention to oppose the Question that Clause 2 stand part of the Bill.
000: Clause 3, leave out Clause 3 and insert—
(1) An incumbent may petition the Lord Chancellor in writing for a certificate establishing the succession for an eldest living son.
(2) An eldest living son, under subsection (1), must have been an eldest living son prior to this Act coming into force.
(3) A petition must be made within 12 months of this Act coming into force.”
000: Clause 3, the Earl of Clancarty gives notice of his intention to oppose the Question that Clause 3 stand part of the Bill.
000: Clause 4, the Earl of Clancarty gives notice of his intention to oppose the Question that Clause 4 stand part of the Bill.
000: Clause 7, page 3, line 38, leave out subsection (1)
000: Clause 7, page 4, line 4, leave out “separately to each such peerage or title” and insert “to all”
